column1: Therefore, not raising any objection shall  be regarded as  a waiver on the part of the

column2: appellant  since  it  is  implied  that  he  clearly  understood  the  charge. The  appellant
had pleaded  not  guilty  and  stood  for  trial.  The Learned  Counsel  for  the  appellant,
the  Magistrate's  Court,  had  raised  a  preliminary  objection  once,  but  did  not
object to  the  charge sheet.  The  Learned Magistrate  in  the  order,  with regard  to  the
said preliminary objection, had  reproduced the charge and mentioned section 73  of
